title: Neighbour star Bonnie Anderson says she is a better person after pledging guilty
text:
Neighbour star Bonnie Anderson has spoken candidly about her year after she was caught covering-up for her allegedly drug abusing ex-boyfriend.

Speaking to the Herald Sun on Saturday, the 24-year-old said her experiences and challenges have helped her become a 'better version of herself.'

'It has been a really important year all round, the good and the bad, you just roll with the punches,' she told the publication.

'You just roll with the punches': Neighbour's Bonnie Anderson (pictured) has spoken candidly about her year after pledging guilty to lying to police to protect her ex-boyfriend

She added: 'I have kind of grown up in the public eye since I was 12. You go through a lot of different stages and learn about yourself.'

Bonnie explained that she also has a lot to be proud of this year as she performed at the Logie Awards and released a new song.

She is also set to perform at Flemington Racecourse in Melbourne on Derby Day on Saturday alongside her boyfriend, Jordan Simi.

Case: In July, Bonnie received a good behaviour bond after she admitted to lying to police in 2017 to protect her drug-using ex-boyfriend, Matt Arnautovic (pictured)

In July, the 24-year-old received a good behaviour bond after she faced a Melbourne court and admitted to lying to police in 2017 to protect her ex-boyfriend.

Bonnie pleaded guilty after she failed to inform police that her then-boyfriend, Matt Arnautovic, was behind the wheel of her car when he drove off from police.

Speaking to the Herald Sun in August, she admitted: 'It was a really terrifying week for me and I will say that quite openly.'

Personal growth: Bonnie (pictured) admitted that 'you go through a lot of different stages and learn about yourself'

'Especially something from the past being brought up, it's something I've moved on from. It's all out in the open and I can move on from that,' she said.

Meanwhile, Bonnie, who won Australia's Got Talent in 2007, recently took a break from filming Neighbours to compete in a new spin-off against former contestants.

Her singing career appears to be her main focus at the moment as she also released of her new single Never Be The One.
description: Neighbour star Bonnie Anderson has spoken candidly about her year after she was caught covering-up for her allegedly drug abusing ex-boyfriend.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
